location: On board PERICLES ship, off Mytilene. A close

lines.speaker: tyrian sailor
lines.text: [To the Sailor of Mytilene]  Where is lord Helicanus he can resolve you. O, here he is. Sir, theres a barge put off from Mytilene, And in it is Lysimachus the governor, Who craves to come aboard. What is your will

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: That he have his. Call up some gentlemen.

lines.speaker: tyrian sailor
lines.text: Ho, gentlemen! my lord calls.
Enter two or three Gentlemen

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Doth your lordship call

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Gentlemen, theres some of worth would come aboard I pray ye, greet them fairly.
The Gentlemen and the two Sailors descend, and go on board the barge
Enter, from thence, LYSIMACHUS and Lords with the Gentlemen and the two Sailors

lines.speaker: tyrian sailor
lines.text: Sir, This is the man that can, in aught you would, Resolve you.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Hail, reverend sir! the gods preserve you!

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: And you, sir, to outlive the age I am, And die as I would do.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: You wish me well. Being on shore, honouring of Neptunes triumphs, Seeing this goodly vessel ride before us, I made to it, to know of whence you are.

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: First, what is your place

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: I am the governor of this place you lie before.

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Sir, Our vessel is of Tyre, in it the king A man who for this three months hath not spoken To any one, nor taken sustenance But to prorogue his grief.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Upon what ground is his distemperature

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Twould be too tedious to repeat But the main grief springs from the loss Of a beloved daughter and a wife.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: May we not see him

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: You may But bootless is your sight: he will not speak To any.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Yet let me obtain my wish.

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Behold him. This was a goodly person, Till the disaster that, one mortal night, Drove him to this.
PERICLES discovered

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Sir king, all hail! the gods preserve you! Hail, royal sir!

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: It is in vain he will not speak to you.

lines.speaker: first lord
lines.text: Sir, We have a maid in Mytilene, I durst wager, Would win some words of him.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Tis well bethought. She questionless with her sweet harmony And other chosen attractions, would allure, And make a battery through his deafend parts, Which now are midway stoppd: She is all happy as the fairest of all, And, with her fellow maids is now upon The leafy shelter that abuts against The islands side.
Whispers a Lord, who goes off in the barge of LYSIMACHUS

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Sure, alls effectless yet nothing well omit That bears recoverys name. But, since your kindness We have stretchd thus far, let us beseech you That for our gold we may provision have, Wherein we are not destitute for want, But weary for the staleness.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: O, sir, a courtesy Which if we should deny, the most just gods For every graff would send a caterpillar, And so afflict our province. Yet once more Let me entreat to know at large the cause Of your kings sorrow.

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Sit, sir, I will recount it to you: But, see, I am prevented.
Reenter, from the barge, Lord, with MARINA, and a young Lady

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: O, here is The lady that I sent for. Welcome, fair one! Ist not a goodly presence

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Shes a gallant lady.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Shes such a one, that, were I well assured Came of a gentle kind and noble stock, Ild wish no better choice, and think me rarely wed. Fair one, all goodness that consists in bounty Expect even here, where is a kingly patient: If that thy prosperous and artificial feat Can draw him but to answer thee in aught, Thy sacred physic shall receive such pay As thy desires can wish.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: Sir, I will use My utmost skill in his recovery, Provided That none but I and my companion maid Be sufferd to come near him.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Come, let us leave her And the gods make her prosperous! Markd he your music
MARINA sings

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: No, nor lookd on us.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: See, she will speak to him.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: Hail, sir! my lord, lend ear.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Hum, ha!

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: I am a maid, My lord, that neer before invited eyes, But have been gazed on like a comet: she speaks, My lord, that, may be, hath endured a grief Might equal yours, if both were justly weighd. Though wayward fortune did malign my state, My derivation was from ancestors Who stood equivalent with mighty kings: But time hath rooted out my parentage, And to the world and awkward casualties Bound me in servitude. I will desist But there is something glows upon my cheek, And whispers in mine ear, Go not till he speak.
Aside

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: My fortunesparentagegood parentage To equal mine!was it not thus what say you

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: I said, my lord, if you did know my parentage, You would not do me violence.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I do think so. Pray you, turn your eyes upon me. You are like something thatWhat countrywoman Here of these shores

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: No, nor of any shores: Yet I was mortally brought forth, and am No other than I appear.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I am great with woe, and shall deliver weeping. My dearest wife was like this maid, and such a one My daughter might have been: my queens square brows Her stature to an inch as wandlike straight As silvervoiced her eyes as jewellike And cased as richly in pace another Juno Who starves the ears she feeds, and makes them hungry, The more she gives them speech. Where do you live

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: Where I am but a stranger: from the deck You may discern the place.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Where were you bred And how achieved you these endowments, which You make more rich to owe

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: If I should tell my history, it would seem Like lies disdaind in the reporting.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Prithee, speak: Falseness cannot come from thee for thou lookst Modest as Justice, and thou seemst a palace For the crownd Truth to dwell in: I will believe thee, And make my senses credit thy relation To points that seem impossible for thou lookst Like one I loved indeed. What were thy friends Didst thou not say, when I did push thee back Which was when I perceived theethat thou camest From good descending

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: So indeed I did.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Report thy parentage. I think thou saidst Thou hadst been tossd from wrong to injury, And that thou thoughtst thy griefs might equal mine, If both were opend.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: Some such thing I said, and said no more but what my thoughts Did warrant me was likely.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Tell thy story If thine considerd prove the thousandth part Of my endurance, thou art a man, and I Have sufferd like a girl: yet thou dost look Like Patience gazing on kings graves, and smiling Extremity out of act. What were thy friends How lost thou them Thy name, my most kind virgin Recount, I do beseech thee: come, sit by me.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: My name is Marina.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: O, I am mockd, And thou by some incensed god sent hither To make the world to laugh at me.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: Patience, good sir, Or here Ill cease.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Nay, Ill be patient. Thou little knowst how thou dost startle me, To call thyself Marina.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: The name Was given me by one that had some power, My father, and a king.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: How! a kings daughter And calld Marina

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: You said you would believe me But, not to be a troubler of your peace, I will end here.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: But are you flesh and blood Have you a working pulse and are no fairy Motion! Well speak on. Where were you born And wherefore calld Marina

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: Calld Marina For I was born at sea.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: At sea! what mother

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: My mother was the daughter of a king Who died the minute I was born, As my good nurse Lychorida hath oft Deliverd weeping.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: O, stop there a little! This is the rarest dream that eer dull sleep Did mock sad fools withal: this cannot be: My daughters buried. Well: where were you bred Ill hear you more, to the bottom of your story, And never interrupt you.
Aside

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: You scorn: believe me, twere best I did give oer.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I will believe you by the syllable Of what you shall deliver. Yet, give me leave: How came you in these parts where were you bred

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: The king my father did in Tarsus leave me Till cruel Cleon, with his wicked wife, Did seek to murder me: and having wood A villain to attempt it, who having drawn to dot, A crew of pirates came and rescued me Brought me to Mytilene. But, good sir, Whither will you have me Why do you weep It may be, You think me an impostor: no, good faith I am the daughter to King Pericles, If good King Pericles be.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Ho, Helicanus!

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Calls my lord

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Thou art a grave and noble counsellor, Most wise in general: tell me, if thou canst, What this maid is, or what is like to be, That thus hath made me weep

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: I know not but Here is the regent, sir, of Mytilene Speaks nobly of her.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: She would never tell Her parentage being demanded that, She would sit still and weep.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: O Helicanus, strike me, honourd sir Give me a gash, put me to present pain Lest this great sea of joys rushing upon me Oerbear the shores of my mortality, And drown me with their sweetness. O, come hither, Thou that begetst him that did thee beget Thou that wast born at sea, buried at Tarsus, And found at sea again! O Helicanus, Down on thy knees, thank the holy gods as loud As thunder threatens us: this is Marina. What was thy mothers name tell me but that, For truth can never be confirmd enough, Though doubts did ever sleep.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: First, sir, I pray, What is your title

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I am Pericles of Tyre: but tell me now My drownd queens name, as in the rest you said Thou hast been godlike perfect, The heir of kingdoms and another like To Pericles thy father.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: Is it no more to be your daughter than To say my mothers name was Thaisa Thaisa was my mother, who did end The minute I began.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Now, blessing on thee! rise thou art my child. Give me fresh garments. Mine own, Helicanus She is not dead at Tarsus, as she should have been, By savage Cleon: she shall tell thee all When thou shalt kneel, and justify in knowledge She is thy very princess. Who is this

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Sir, tis the governor of Mytilene, Who, hearing of your melancholy state, Did come to see you.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I embrace you. Give me my robes. I am wild in my beholding. O heavens bless my girl! But, hark, what music Tell Helicanus, my Marina, tell him Oer, point by point, for yet he seems to doubt, How sure you are my daughter. But, what music

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: My lord, I hear none.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: None! The music of the spheres! List, my Marina.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: It is not good to cross him give him way.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Rarest sounds! Do ye not hear

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: My lord, I hear.
Music

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Most heavenly music! It nips me unto listening, and thick slumber Hangs upon mine eyes: let me rest.
Sleeps

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: A pillow for his head: So, leave him all. Well, my companion friends, If this but answer to my just belief, Ill well remember you.
Exeunt all but PERICLES
DIANA appears to PERICLES as in a vision

lines.speaker: diana
lines.text: My temple stands in Ephesus: hie thee thither, And do upon mine altar sacrifice. There, when my maiden priests are met together, Before the people all, Reveal how thou at sea didst lose thy wife: To mourn thy crosses, with thy daughters, call And give them repetition to the life. Or perform my bidding, or thou livest in woe Do it, and happy by my silver bow! Awake, and tell thy dream.
Disappears

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Celestial Dian, goddess argentine, I will obey thee. Helicanus!
Reenter HELICANUS, LYSIMACHUS, and MARINA

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Sir

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: My purpose was for Tarsus, there to strike The inhospitable Cleon but I am For other service first: toward Ephesus Turn our blown sails eftsoons Ill tell thee why. Shall we refresh us, sir, upon your shore, And give you gold for such provision As our intents will need
To LYSIMACHUS

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Sir, With all my heart and, when you come ashore, I have another suit.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: You shall prevail, Were it to woo my daughter for it seems You have been noble towards her.

lines.speaker: lysimachus
lines.text: Sir, lend me your arm.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Come, my Marina.
Exeunt
